title: Ramspur 2012 Otton Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Baked bread and brown sugar make this a comforting wine in some sense. Similarly, the fruit follows a baked quality that makes it taste bigger than it is. Meanwhile, herbal leanings betray the wine's low level of alcohol.

title: Luis Segundo Correas 2011 Valle Las Acequias Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Grassy, herbal aromas rest on top of basic red-fruit notes. This feels choppy and hollow, with flavors of buttery oak, chemical and red currant. The raw hot finish doesn't have a lot of body or padding.

title: Halleck 2013 Three Sons Cuvee Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Reduced in a weight of oak and tight tannins, this wine takes time to come around and develop any juiciness to the palate, offering a mix of red cherry and cranberry laced in forest and spice. It finishes quick and lean.

title: Henry Estate 2014 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: Somewhat disjointed, this watery effort hints at berry flavors, with a bit of road tar and cola.

title: Oak Knoll 2012 Dion Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine, aged in stainless steel barrels, offers muted berry fruit, somewhat masked by aromas of rubber tire and plastic. The finish is short and slightly bitter.

title: Paso a Paso 2014 White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Stalky aromas of corn, apple and white flowers lack focus. This feels blocky, while salty flavors of cured ham blend with leesy flavors of papaya and peach. A moderate basic finish is par for the course.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana Rosé (Alentejano)
description: Ripe and fruity, this is a rich style of rosé. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, it is full of ripe raspberry and red plum flavors that are soft and generous, although lacking acidity. Drink now.

title: Twisted 2013 Moscato (California)
description: Light apple and floral aromas lead to rich flavors like apple, honey and grapefruit and a definite sweetness. This wine is fresh and easy to enjoy.

title: Egeo 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Offering a flat opening with no kick, it is akin to sniffing apple juice. This is plump and wan in feel, with melon and banana flavors, while a soft, no-edge finish doesn't leave much of a lasting impression.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Monta da Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: With some earthy, rustic flavors the wine seems to have missed out on some of its fruit. It is more about structure and firm tannins with only hints of juicy fruit behind.

title: Château Laulerie 2014 White (Bergerac Sec)
description: This fresh, vibrant wine is light and fruity. A classic blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, it has an herbal character along with bright green and citrus fruits. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Costa di Bussia 2011 Vigna Campo del Gatto  (Barbera d'Alba)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, game, burned rubber and a funky whiff of barnyard waft out of the glass and carry over to the dense palate along with raisin, fig, licorice and a gamy note. It's rustic and extremely evolved with an abrupt, bitter finish.

title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2011 Vargosa Red (Douro)
description: The initial shock is of intense acidity. Only after a while, do the structure and the fruit show. It makes this an unbalanced wine, the structure out of kilter with the fruit.

title: Loscano 2010 Gran Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Grainy oak and green aromas rest on top of generic red-fruit scents. This feels chunky, blocky and tannic, with herbaceous medicinal flavors of tomato, oak resin and green herbs. A spicy saucy-tasting finish holds onto the wine's minty green herbal essence.

title: Lucky NV Proprietary Red (North Coast)
description: Fully ripe aromas and flavors like prunes and raisins and a soft, lightly tannic texture make this a bold but not harsh wine. A touch of spicy oak adds complexity and full body helps the flavors linger.

title: Fowles Wine 2012 Are You Game? Pinot Noir (Victoria)
description: There's 10% Zinfandel blended into this wine, but looking at my notes, I never would've thought so. The pale color is all Pinot Noir, as are the aromas of earth and tomato (the vanilla comes from the French oak barrels). It's light and crisp, with a tart finish.

title: Merisi 2014 Pinot Gris (Los Carneros)
description: Concentrated and intense, this wine has a mix of sour lemon and potatoes going on aromatically. It is medium to full bodied, rather than crisp and light.

title: Segura Viudas NV Reserva Heredad Sparkling (Cava)
description: Leesy aromas of wheat and corn are low on fruit and general appeal. This feels regular at best. Grassy gaseous flavors of bitter melon, lime and apple finish leesy and uncommitted, with flabby weight. For whatever reason, this is below prior benchmarks.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2014 Inspiración Valdemar Alto Cantabria Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Green grassy aromas are modest and watery. This feels oily, but with decent acidity. Oxidized flavors of stone fruits finish wheaty, bland and eggy.

title: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)
description: Herbal and thin, this is not the fleshy, fruity style typical of Oregon Pinot Gris. Dilute flavors of apple and melon are smothered in herbs.

title: Bernier 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: Less tangy than some Loire Sauvignon Blanc, this easy, soft wine has attractive acidity and a balanced, steely texture. It's crisp, with some herbaceousness over grapefruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Copaboca 2014 Peramor Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A gaseous smelling nose and a chunky palate are not motivational, while flavors of banana and melon aren't much better. Overall, this is a basic Verdejo that's starting to fade.

title: Finca Perdriel 2012 Colección Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This wine has showed no consistency over the years. This vintage is black and extracted with piercing inky blackberry aromas. In the mouth, it's huge, chunky and grating. Overdone black-fruit flavors finish clampy with oaky bitterness and a sense of reduction.

title: Luis Segundo Correas 2011 Valle Las Acequias Finca Don Angelino Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Scratchy raspberry aromas are jammy but also green, with a strange hint of perfume. This feels chunky and rubbery, with stretchy, elastic tannins. Flavors of baked berry fruits, prune and herbs finish hot.
designation: Valle Las Acequias Finca Don Angelino Single Vineyard

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013  Bourgogne
description: Crisp with an edge of honey, this is a ripe and fruity wine. Along with apple and cantaloupe melon flavors it has a nutty character and some light acidity, both of which add to its simple attraction. Drink now.

title: Saturday Night Red 2012 Red (California)
description: Earthy aromas and meaty flavors make this medium-bodied wine a bit of a wild card. Consumers expecting an average red blend may find this too funky, but it does feel rich and have a lingering finish.

title: Nicolas Idiart 2014 Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)
description: This wine is soft and fruity, with a smoky touch that adds interest. Red-cherry flavors and balanced acidity allow easy accessibility. The wine, with its gentle texture, is ready to drink.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monta da Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: A fruity, young and crisp wine that is all about raspberry and red currant fruits. It is fresh with just a hint of caramel and with bright acidity at the end.

title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, this is a soft wine, fruity with ripe red and white fruit flavors. It is a light wine with only a hint of tannin, much more in the way of gentle fruitiness.

title: Carlos Basso 2011 Viña Amalia Reserva Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)
description: Soupy, saucy aromas are akin to tomato sauce. This is wide, chunky and struggling for textural balance. Stalky roasted plum flavors finish herbal, spicy and flabby in feel.
